data.title: not that good
data.text: we got there a little early. early for wieners. probably  should have had breakfast. but were told the wieners were ready.seems like they could have been above average but we got cold buns and icey(straight from the refrigerator) onions. kind of ruined the meal. fresh onions and a hot bun would have made all the difference. fries were frozen( i hate that). service was nothing to shout about either. won't be back.

owner_response.author: Ali B, Public Relations Manager at City Hall Diner, responded to this review
owner_response.text: I'm sorry about your bad experience. I did send you a message on groupon about the onions weren't old, we cut them fresh every morning and put them in a container in fridge. Also, I am not sure why the bun wasn't heated up I will definitely let my staff know about that mistake. I would like you to come back and have 2 free wieners on us and let us know your name and ask for the manager on duty when you come in. Look forward to seeing you soon.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: A real diner.  Good food, service and atmosphere.
data.text: This is amazing, born and brought up in Cranston, R. I., and can't remember ever going in here.  Maybe I did, just can't remember.  Now I come 9000 miles to visit a neighborhood restaurant.  Was at a bank nearby and needed breakfast, and City Hall Diner is stearing me in the face, so in we popped.  This is what I call an old fashioned diner.  Long counter and stools on the right, 4-6 tables on the left, and short order cook flippin' my pancakes and rolling my omelette.  Fantastic feeling, diner waitress taking the order and serving the food.  Its like home.  People who did not grow up with diners will just not know the feeling.  Great food, service and atmosphere.  It is a tiny place right on Park Avenue, near the corner with Rolf Street, and a stones throw from Cranston City Hall.  Very reasonable prices, restrooms in back.   And I run into an old friend also.
